      • addAlgorithmFactory

        public void addAlgorithmFactory(java.lang.String name,
                                AlgorithmFactory factory)
        Adds a named algorithm factory to the controller, which allows for usage of the named factory in swarm.command and device.*.command
        Parameters:
        name - the string name to associate with the factory
        factory - the factory that creates the algorithm

      • initVars

        public void initVars(long id,
                     long processes)
        Initialize the variables within the controller
        Parameters:

        processes - the number of processes participating in the swarm

      • initVars

        public void initVars(BasePlatform platform)
        Initialize the variables for a platform. This function is useful for user-defined platforms and essentially shares the controller's KnowledgeBase, self-identifying variables, etc.
        Parameters:
        platform - the user-defined platform

      • initVars

        public void initVars(BaseAlgorithm algorithm)
        Initialize the variables for an algorithm. This function is useful for user-defined algorithms and essentially shares the controller's KnowledgeBase, self-identifying variables, etc.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the user-defined algorithm

      • monitor

        public long monitor()
        Monitors the platform's sensors
        Returns:
        status of monitor. 0 is full success, though this is not currently checked.

      • plan

        public long plan()
        Plans the algorithm and accents
        Returns:
        status of plan. 0 is full success, though this is not currently checked.

      • run

        public long run(double period,
                double duration)
        Runs the monitor, analyze, plan and execute loop with a specific period and duration
        Parameters:
        period - the time in between executions of the loop in seconds
        duration - the duration of the loop in seconds
        Returns:
        status of run. 0 is full success, though this is not currently checked.

      • run

        public long run(double loopPeriod,
                double duration,
                double sendPeriod)
        Runs iterations of the MAPE loop with specified periods between loops
        Parameters:
        loopPeriod - time in seconds between executions of the loop. 0 means run as fast as possible (no sleeps).
        duration - the duration of time spent running the loop in seconds. Negative duration means run loop forever. 0 duration means run once.
        sendPeriod - time in seconds between sending updates over network. If sendPeriod is non-positive, loopPeriod is used.
        Returns:
        status of run. 0 is full success, though this is not currently checked.

      • runHz

        public long runHz(double loopHz,
                  double duration,
                  double sendHz)
        Runs iterations of the MAPE loop with specified hertz
        Parameters:
        loopHz - the intended hz at which the loop should execute. anything non-negative is valid. 0hz is treated as as infinite hertz (i.e., run as fast as possible).
        duration - the duration of time spent running the loop in seconds. Negative duration means run loop forever. 0 duration means run once.
        sendHz - the intended hz at which updates should be sent. If non-positive, loopHz is used.
        Returns:
        the result of the MAPE loop

      • systemAnalyze

        public long systemAnalyze()
        Analyzes the controller and system
        Returns:
        status of analyze. 0 is full success, though this is not currently checked.

      • free

        public void free()
        Deletes the C instantiation. To prevent memory leaks, this must be called before an instance of WaitSettings gets garbage collected
